title: What is this thing? Our mail carrier keeps leaving it in our ... - Reddit
body: New guy filling in on your route. Probably a parcel marker meaning you have or had a package to be delivered that didn't fit into the regular mail. It's kind of confusing if it keeps getting left over and over. Would require context. r/USPS. A community to discuss USPS related topics.
readable_content:
- USMC0317 (2015-12-08): What is this thing? Our mail carrier keeps leaving it in our mailbox?
  ![image](imgur.com)
  - CaptainOatboats: Your carrier uses that as a marker and puts it with your mail to let them know they have a package for you. They're most likely not realizing they're leaving it in your box.
  - IMissBeingMe: Put it back in the box with a small cookie, mint, etc. Tiny things like that are never forgotten and almost always ensure your package gets that extra attention. Bonus points for a funny note like "You can pick either one. I keep the label, you get the cookie ;)" Stuff like that totally makes our day. The job is hard and mistakes like this are embarrassing but they happen. Letting him off the hook with a joke is a very nice gesture.
  It also serves to remind him next time not to F it up. Ugh...CCA's...amiright?
  (J/K, I love you guys!)
  - Skeetronic: New guy filling in on your route. Probably a parcel marker meaning you have or had a package to be delivered that didn't fit into the regular mail. It's kind of confusing if it keeps getting left over and over. Would require context
